title: Graph of plunger and syringe volume

content.prompt: Students in a lab are given the plunger-syringe system represented above, which contains air at room temperature. The students take their physics textbooks and place them on top of the plunger one at a time. Each time a book is added, they allow the system to come to room temperature and then record the volume of the air in the syringe. Assume that air may be treated as an ideal gas. Which of the following best represents the expected graph of the volume of the air as a function of the number of books?

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
